channel.title: U.S. News - News
channel.description: Get breaking news from the US and the world. Read about politics, the economy, health care, the environment, education, the Trump administration, Congress and state, local and global government.

item.title: Investigators Probe Reported Russian Tundra Pollution
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Russia’s main criminal investigation body has launched a probe after a report that a nickel-processing plant was pumping water contaminated with heavy metals into the Arctic tundra.

item.title: Black Bear Rescued as Cub Released Back Into Wyoming Woods
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A young black bear is back in the wild in western Wyoming after being rescued as a cub.

item.title: Lazarus Chakwera Inaugurated as Malawi's New President
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Lazarus Chakwera has been sworn in as Malawi’s new president after the announcement that he won the southern African country’s rerun elections.

item.title: Confirmed Cases Hit 10 Million; Pence Skips Campaign Rallies
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Worldwide confirmed coronavirus infections have hit the 10 million mark as voters in Poland and France went to the polls for virus-delayed elections.

item.title: Black Candidates Push Race Debate Into GOP-Held Districts
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The reenergized movement against racial inequality and police brutality following the killing of George Floyd has amplified the voices of Black candidates across the country.

item.title: DC Mayor Caught Between Activists, Police in Funding Battle
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Muriel Bowser’s national profile had never been higher, thanks to a Twitter beef with President Donald Trump and a renewed push to turn the nation’s capital into the 51st state.

item.title: Officials: Fireworks Spark Utah Wildfire, Evacuations
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Utah officials say fireworks caused a wildfire that forced out residents of several houses and from an apartment building early Sunday as flames threatened the homes.

item.title: China Reviews Heavily Criticized Hong Kong Security Bill
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: China's legislature is reviewing a controversial national security bill for Hong Kong that critics worldwide say will severely compromise human rights in the semi-autonomous Chinese region.

item.title: Officials: Fireworks Spark Utah Wildfire, Evacuations
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Utah officials say fireworks caused a wildfire that forced out residents of several houses and from an apartment building early Sunday as flames threatened the homes.

item.title: The Latest: Confirmed Coronavirus Cases Pass 10 Million
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Confirmed coronavirus infections have surpassed the 10 million mark worldwide.

item.title: Taiwan Holds LGBT Pride Parade Despite Coronavirus
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The Taiwanese capital has held its annual LGBT pride parade, making it one of the few places in the world to proceed with such an event in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How Germany Did It: Completing the Soccer Season in Europe
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Only the fans were missing as Bayern Munich celebrated its title Saturday and the Bundesliga breathed a sigh of relief.

item.title: France Holds Municipal Elections Postponed by Virus Crisis
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: France is holding the second round of municipal elections that got postponed due to the country's coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: AP Interview: US Envoy Calls for Iran Arms Embargo Renewal
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The U.S. special representative to Iran says a United Nations weapons embargo on Tehran must remain in place.

item.title: Rolling Stones Threaten to Sue Trump Over Using Their Songs
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The Rolling Stones are threatening President Donald Trump with legal action for using their songs at his rallies despite cease-and-desist directives.

item.title: Poles Face Long Lines, Coronavirus Limits in Presidential Vote
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Joanna Plucinska and Anna KoperWARSAW (Reuters) - Poles stood in long lines to vote on Sunday in a closely-fought presidential election that...

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: TAIPEI (Reuters) - Hundreds of people thronged a central square in Taiwan's capital Taipei for a Pride event on Sunday, unfurling a giant rainbow...

item.title: U.S. Sanctions, Coronavirus Make for Iran's Toughest Year, Rouhani Says
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: DUBAI (Reuters) - Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Sunday that his country is experiencing its toughest year because of U.S. sanctions...

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: KINSHASA (Reuters) - Democratic Republic of Congo's prime minister protested on Sunday over the brief arrest of the justice minister, saying the...

item.title: A Divided Poland Holds Presidential Vote Delayed by Pandemic
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Poles have begun voting in a presidential election that had been scheduled for May but was delayed by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Israeli Court Releases Anti-Netanyahu Activist After Arrest
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A Jerusalem court has released a former Air Force general and leading activist opposed to Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu whose arrest prompted hundreds to protest outside the Israeli leader’s residence.

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: SHANGHAI (Reuters) - China's lawmakers have reviewed a draft of the national security bill for Hong Kong during a meeting held by the standing...

item.title: 'Get Britain Moving Again', PM Johnson to Unveil New Infrastructure Plan
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Elizabeth PiperLONDON (Reuters) - Prime Minister Boris Johnson will launch a plan this week to get Britain "moving again" after the coronavirus...

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Kanishka Singh(Reuters) - A shooting at a Walmart distribution center in Red Bluff, California, killed at least two people and injured four...

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - The first minister of Wales, Mark Drakeford, said on Sunday he was concerned about the messaging deployed by British Prime...

item.title: Dozens Arrested as Hong Kongers Protest Planned National Security Laws
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Scott MurdochHONG KONG (Reuters) - Hong Kong police arrested at least 53 people on Sunday after scuffles erupted during a relatively peaceful...

item.title: 2 Dead After Shooting at California Distribution Center
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Authorities say a man drove into a Northern California distribution center and started shooting at people, killing an employee and wounding four others before he was killed by police.

item.title: World Leaders, Stars Unite at Event Aimed at Fighting Virus
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A summit that included a star-studded virtual event hosted by Dwayne Johnson has raised nearly $7 billion in cash and loan guarantees to assist the poor around the globe whose lives have been upended by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: DaBaby, Roddy Ricch to Help BET Celebrate Awards Virtually
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: BET will celebrate its 40th year as a network, as well as it 20th awards show, on Sunday — but the event will go on virtually because of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Mental Health Issues Compounded by COVID-19 Quarantine
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: ST. AUGUSTINE, Fla. (AP) — For Northeast Florida residents with substance dependency, rocky relationships, mental health issues and other challenges, COVID-19 added another layer of stress that left unchecked, experts fear, could lead to worse outcomes.

item.title: Miami’s Black Officers Conflicted About Protests, Loyalties
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: MIAMI (AP) — During the first demonstrations in downtown Miami against police brutality toward Blacks, hundreds of protesters marched through the streets as squads of officers ringed police headquarters to protect the building.

item.title: Officials: Florida Woman Dies in Gunfire With Deputies
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Florida authorities say a white woman was shot dead after firing at sheriff deputies.

item.title: Black Lives Matter Mural Vandalized in Orlando
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Police in Florida say that a new mural with the giant slogan for Black Lives Matter was vandalized hours after being painted on a street in downtown Orlando.

item.title: 2 Dead After Shooting at California Distribution Center
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Authorities say a man drove into a Northern California distribution center and started shooting at people Saturday, killing an employee and wounding four others before he was killed by police.

item.title: Czech Republic's Daily Number of New Coronavirus Cases Highest Since April 8
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: PRAGUE (Reuters) - The daily number of new coronavirus cases in the Czech Republic jumped to 260, the highest since April 8, mainly due to surge in...

item.title: Comfort Levels Vary for Michigan Arts, Culture Customers
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: DETROIT (AP) — When will people in southeast Michigan be ready to head back to museums, concerts, galleries and other cultural attractions?

item.title: Yale Student Creates 'OKZoomer,' a Dating Site Amid Pandemic
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: DALLAS (AP) — When Ileana Valdez, a Dallas-native and junior at Yale University, found out she wouldn’t be going back to campus after spring break due to the COVID-19 outbreak, she and her friends created a dating site, OKZoomer.

item.title: Mother Walks in Honor of Slain Son at Drive-Thru Graduation
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C. (AP) — Seventeen years after graduating from Glenn High School, Nakeshia Collins was again decked out in a cap and gown, walking across the stage to collect a diploma.

item.title: Mississippi Set to Remove Confederate Emblem From Its Flag
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Mississippi is on the verge of changing its state flag to erase a Confederate battle emblem that’s broadly condemned as racist.

item.title: What Doctors Have Learned About Fighting COVID-19
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Deena Beasley(Reuters) - In the six months since an entirely new coronavirus began spreading around the world, doctors and hospitals have...

item.title: Factbox: Quotes of Fear, Defiance and Hope as the Coronavirus Pandemic Spans the Globe
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: (Reuters) - Here is a selection of quotes about the global COVID-19 pandemic, which has infected 10 million people and killed nearly 500,000 people...

item.title: One Dead, Another Injured in Shooting at Jefferson Square Park in Louisville
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Kanishka Singh(Reuters) - One person died and another was injured in a shooting late on Saturday in Louisville, Kentucky's Jefferson Square Park...

item.title: Hoosiers' Embrace of ‘Victory Gardens’ Grows During Pandemic
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — In the midst of World War II, Americans came together to grow fruits and vegetables in their backyards, forming a network of victory gardens that at one point provided as much as 40% of the country’s vegetables. Today, thousands of Americans are turning to victory gardens again, but for a very different fight — the fight against climate change.

item.title: IU Freshmen Still Hope for ‘College Experience’ in Pandemic
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind. (AP) — Lauren Jacobson’s biggest fear about starting college at Indiana University this fall is being stuck in her dorm room alone.

item.title: Tupelo IT Workers Transition City Employees to Remote Work
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: TUPELO, Miss. (AP) — As COVID-19 made its way to the All-America City, three workers tucked inside an often unseen wing on the second floor of City Hall knew they would have to start thinking outside the box to equip most of the city’s employees with the tools needed to start working remotely.

item.title: This Alabama Dining Gem Is Hidden in Plain Sight
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: HOOVER, Ala. (AP) — Tucked away in a retail center off Hoover’s busy John Hawkins Parkway, Jake’s Soul Food Café is practically hidden in plain sight.

item.title: Blend Coffee House Brews up Ways to Help Students
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: SUMITON, Ala. (AP) — Joey and Nancy Clark opened The Blend Coffee House in a small building on Main Street in Sumiton in November 2018, but they quickly outgrew the space.

item.title: CeeLo Green Discusses the Authenticity of His New Album
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: ATLANTA (AP) — There are many shades to CeeLo Green.

item.title: Rally to Support Law Enforcement Held in Sioux Falls
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A rally to support law enforcement drew about 100 people and some protesters in Sioux Falls.

item.title: Dustin Poirier Win Decision Over Dan Hooker in UFC Thriller
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Dustin Poirier won a thrilling unanimous decision over Dan Hooker by surviving a brutal second round and putting on a well-rounded performance in the main event at the UFC’s corporate gym.

item.title: 1 Fatally Shot at Breonna Taylor Protest Park in Kentucky
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Authorities are investigating a fatal shooting at a park in downtown Louisville, Kentucky, where demonstrators had gathered to protest the death of Breonna Taylor.

item.title: Louisville, Kentucky, Police Say 1 Dead, 1 Injured in Shooting at Park Hosting Protests Over Breonna Taylor's Death
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Louisville, Kentucky, police say 1 dead, 1 injured in shooting at park hosting protests over Breonna Taylor's death.

item.title: Democrats Want John Wayne's Name, Statue Taken off Airport
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: In the latest move to change place names in light of U.S. racial history, leaders of Orange County’s Democratic Party are pushing to drop film legend John Wayne’s name, statue and other likenesses from the county’s airport because of his racist and bigoted comments.

item.title: 1-Year-Old Boy Killed, Mom Wounded in Chicago Shooting
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A 1-year-old boy died Saturday in a shooting that also wounded his mother while she was driving in Chicago with the child in the back seat of the car.

item.title: Opposition Wins Historic Rerun of Malawi's Presidential Vote
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The opposition has won Malawi’s historic rerun of the presidential election.

item.title: Coroner: 3rd Illinois Shooting Victim Dies, 2 Identified
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Authorities say a third person died Saturday afternoon who was critically wounded in a shooting at a warehouse in central Illinois where the suspect had fatally shot two coworkers before apparently killing himself.

item.title: The Latest: South Korea Still Coping With New Virus Clusters
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: South Korea has confirmed 62 additional cases of the coronavirus over a 24-hour period as the Asian country continues to face new clusters of infections amid eased social distancing rules.

item.title: Ireland to Keep Its 14-Day Quarantine on British Travellers: Sunday Times
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: (Reuters) - Ireland will maintain a 14-day quarantine for travellers from the British mainland in July even as it plans to ease travel restrictions...

item.title: NWSL Players Kneel During the National Anthem
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Players for the Portland Thorns and the North Carolina Courage knelt during the national anthem Saturday as the National Women’s Soccer League opened the Challenge Cup tournament in Utah.

item.title: 4 Men Charged in Attack on Jackson Statue Near White House
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Federal authorities have charged four men in connection with a failed effort last week to pull down the statue of President Andrew Jackson near the White House.

item.title: Asia Today: South Korea Reports 62 New Cases, China Has 17

item.description: South Korea has confirmed 62 additional cases of the coronavirus over a 24-hour period, as the country continues to grapple with new clusters after easing social distancing rules.

item.title: St. Patrick's Cathedral to Resume Indoor Sunday Mass
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: St. Patrick’s Cathedral in New York City is set to hold its first indoor Mass in three months, with precautions against the coronavirus in place.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Hospital says 2 people were killed, 4 are in fair condition after shooting at Walmart distribution center in California.

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: (Reuters) - UK's most senior civil servant Sir Mark Sedwill will announce his departure as early as this week under Boris Johnson's plans for a...

item.title: Late Scratch: Harvick Knocks off Pocono From Winless List
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Kevin Harvick snapped an 0-for-38 drought at Pocono Raceway, taking the checkered flag Saturday at one of two tracks where victory had eluded him.

item.title: AP Source: Yankees Vs Champ Nationals in DC on Opening Day
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Gerrit Cole could make his New York Yankees debut in a tasty opening-day treat for fans, facing Juan Soto and World Series champion Washington at Nationals Park.

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Cate CadellBEIJING (Reuters) - Global coronavirus cases exceeded 10 million on Sunday according to a Reuters tally, marking a major milestone in...

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The White House on Saturday denied that President Donald Trump was briefed on reported U.S. intelligence that Russia's...

item.title: AP Interview: Delhi Minister Says City Faces Virus Challenge
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: New Delhi's acting health minister says the Indian capital is facing a shortage of “trained and experienced” health care workers.

item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: By Richard Lough and Michel RosePARIS (Reuters) - Voters in France donned face masks to cast their ballots on Sunday in a delayed second round of...

item.title: Mississippi Takes Step Toward Dropping Rebel Image From Flag
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Mississippi lawmakers are close to erasing the Confederate battle emblem from the 126-year-old state flag.

item.title: Satellite Images Show Buildup on Disputed India-China Border
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Satellite images released this week show construction activity under way on both the Indian and Chinese sides of a contested border high in the Karakoram mountains a week after a deadly clash in the area left 20 Indian soldiers dead.

item.title: Biden Campaign Says 36% of Senior Staff Are People of Color
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Joe Biden’s campaign says more than a third of its senior staff are people of color.

item.title: Rochester-Area Religious Leaders Call for Racial Justice
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Religious leaders in the Rochester area called for criminal justice reforms and other racial justice measures at an interfaith prayer service urging unity and change.

item.title: Health Agency: Data Entry Error Caused Bulge in Case Reports
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Nevada on Saturday reported a record daily increase of additional confirmed COVID-19 cases.

item.title: 4 California Officers on Leave Amid Probe of Racist Posts
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Four police officers in Northern California have been placed on administrative leave while officials investigate a Facebook group in which members made bigoted and anti-Muslim comments.

item.title: Biden Slams Trump Over Reported Bounties Placed on US Troops
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Joe Biden is sharply criticizing President Donald Trump over a report that he says, if true, contains a “truly shocking revelation” about the commander in chief and his failure to protect U.S. troops and stand up to Russia.

item.title: Protesters Face off Over Statue of St. Louis Namesake
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Protesters are calling for the removal of a statue of St. Louis’ namesake, a French king-turned-saint who burned manuscript copies of Jewish religious texts during the Middle Ages, while another group is praying for the monument to stay.

item.title: Alaska Tribe to Decide Fate of European Explorer Statue
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The mayor of Anchorage has asked the Native Village of Eklutna to determine what happens to a statue of a British explorer following calls for its removal.

item.title: 4 Albuquerque Fireworks Displays Planned to Avoid Gatherings
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Albuquerque and Bernalillo County are teaming up to stage July Fourth fireworks displays in each quadrant of the metro area to encourage residents to avoid congregating in any one area while restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak remain in effect.

item.title: Georgia Reports 1,990 New Cases of COVID-19, Breaking Record
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Georgia health officials on Saturday reported 1,990 additional COVID-19 cases, another record in newly confirmed coronavirus cases in the state.

item.title: City of Honolulu Limits Permits for Reopened Campgrounds
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The city of Honolulu has announced that campgrounds will reopen for the first time in three months with limited permits to ensure social distancing amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Police: Noose Left at Black Man's Home in Delaware
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Delaware State Police say they have opened a hate crime investigation after a Black man reported finding a cord tied into a noose outside his home.

item.title: Pence Cancels Some Political Events Because of Virus Spikes
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence has called off campaign events in Florida and Arizona for this coming week as the states experience a surge in new coronavirus cases.

item.title: Man Accused of Skipping Seizure Meds Before Deadly Crash
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A Missouri man accused of skipping his seizure medication and drinking a cocktail before causing a fatal motorcycle crash has been charged with involuntary manslaughter.

item.title: Low-Income California Zip Codes See Spike in Virus Cases
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Data show hundreds of new infections in densely populated neighborhoods that are more likely home to low-income residents in one California county.

item.title: Arkansas Reports 570 More COVID-19 Cases
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Arkansas on Saturday reported 570 more cases of the coronavirus and 10 more deaths.

item.title: Texas Pilot of Small Plane Dies in Crash as He Tries to Land
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Officials say a 40-year-old pilot died when his small plane crashed as he tried to land on a private runway in East Texas early Saturday morning.

item.title: New Mexico Hospitals to Resume Patient Visitations
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Hospitals in New Mexico have started to loosen restrictions that kept family and friends from visiting patients.

item.title: Tyson Foods: 371 Positive COVID-19 Tests at Missouri Plant
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Tyson Foods has announced that 371 employees at its chicken processing plant in the far southwestern corner of Missouri have tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Trump's Brother Asks Another Court to Halt Niece's Book
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Donald Trump’s brother is asking another court to halt publication of a tell-all book by the president’s niece, after his first bid was rejected by a New York City judge Thursday.

item.title: 2nd Minnesota Inmate Dies After Testing COVID-19 Positive
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: State corrections officials say a second Minnesota prison inmate has died after testing positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Confirmed Virus Cases Continue to Climb in Oregon
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Oregon reached a new second-highest daily number Saturday with 277 cases.

item.title: 18-Year-Old Fatally Shot Near Busy Atlanta Street
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: An 18-year-old man was fatally shot in Atlanta’s busy midtown neighborhood Saturday.

item.title: Louisiana Woman Arrested for Theft of Rent Payments
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A Louisiana woman faces charges after she allegedly stole nearly $87,000 in rent payments from an apartment complex.

item.title: Health Officials: 2 Seward Businesses Exposed to COVID-19
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Health officials in Alaska have urged anyone who went to two Seward businesses to take a COVID-19 test after potentially being exposed to the coronavirus.

item.title: The Latest: Man City Will Give Liverpool Guard of Honor
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says they will form a guard of honor for new English Premier League champion Liverpool when they meet next Thursday.
